title: Scss Overview
description: CSS is written in Sass using the SCSS (Sassy CSS) sytanx. Compiling is handled by gulp.

sections.title: SCSS Folder Structure
description: SCSS is divided into 6 categories of code. Docs subsections detail each category. `styles.scss` SHOULD `@import` all SCSS files to be compiled into CSS.

sections.title: SCSS Parts
description: In order from smallest to largest: `bits`, `elements`, `items`, `collections`, `sections`, `layouts`. Examples below.

sections.title: Create Generics
description: A generic MUST be a placeholder for the most common version of an `item` or `collection`. Generics are extended initially by a class of the same name (ie. `%btn` is extended by `.btn`).
Modifiers MUST be children of classes and not generics. Additional extensions of the generic MUST NOT modify existing properties on the generic, they MUST only augment the generic.

sections.title: Children and Modifiers
description: Selector naming conventions make it easier to to understand Scss code.

Top level classes SHOULD be named a single short word (eg. `box`). Related children MUST be named using the parent name followed by two underscores followed by the child's name (eg. `box__header`). Parent-child relationships SHOULD only go one level deep (ie. `box__header__title` is discouraged). Parent child relationships SHOULD only exist in `collections`.
Modifiers MUST be named using a dash and the modifiers name (eg. `-main`). Modifiers MUST follow the class they are modifying (eg. `btn -main`).
